comment.author: 61271636@N05
comment._content: The sign Robbinsville was what Thirroul used to be called.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/61271636@N05] Thanks, that makes sense. I checked the larger version and just above "Robbinsville" is "Late".

AB

comment.author: 61271636@N05
comment._content: Robbinsville is the English name for the suburb which was named after one of the earliest residents in the area "Frederick Robbins" but it was officially changed to Thirroul in 1892 which was adopted by the Railways Department, the suburb name itself derives from the word Thurrural which roughly translate in Aboriginal to "The Valley of the Cabbage Tree". This coming from a former resident who lived close to the area for 5 years.
